item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Since it is so likely that (children) will meet cruel enemies, let them at least have heard of brave knights and heroic courage. Otherwise you are making their destiny not brighter but darker." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish, but have eternal life." -- Anonymous

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me." -- Anonymous

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "You get old and you realize there are no answers, just stories." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Thank you, dear God, for this good life and forgive us if we do not love it enough." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Frank Peretti
item.description: "You want proof there's a God? Look outside, watch a sunset." -- Frank Peretti

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Dee Henderson
item.description: "I love you, in my mind where my thoughts reside, in my heart where my emotions live, and in my soul where my dreams are born. I love you." -- Dee Henderson

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Roy Croft
item.description: "I love you, not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you." -- Roy Croft

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "The purpose of writing is to inflate weak ideas, obscure poor reasoning and inhibit clarity." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "When I write, I feel like an armless, legless man with a crayon in his mouth." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Lisa Wingate
item.description: "A bad past is like gristle. You can chew on it forever and starve yourself to death, or you can spit it out and see what else is on the table." -- Lisa Wingate

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
item.description: "We shall find peace. We shall hear angels, we shall see the sky sparkling with diamonds." -- Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Crystal Laine add a quote by Francine Rivers
item.description: "Beloved, surrender wholeheartedly to Jesus Christ, who loves you. As you drink from the deep well of Scripture, the Lord will refresh you and cleanse you, mold you and re-create you through His Living Word. For the Bible is the very breath of God, giving life eternal to those who seek Him." -- Francine Rivers
